```{r biasramp, fig.cap="Estimated recruitment deviations (top panel) and bias adjustment ramp (bottom panel). The ramp corresponds to the ratio of the standard error in the estimated recruitment deviations to the overall variance in recruitment; during periods of data-richness, this ratio is reduced (as more data are available to inform the deviations) and therefore the ramp assigns the heaviest weight to those model years within the likelihood function. Very recent years are less certain as we have not yet seen these recruitment events in the compositional data, which is anticipated to happen at a roughly 3-year lag for GOA Flathead sole.",  eval = T}
knitr::include_graphics(here('model_runs','m0_8-newMI-biasAdj','plots','bias_adj_panel.png'))
```

(ref:SSBcap2) Spawning stock biomass relative to B~35%~ and fishing mortality (F) relative to  F~35%~ from 1978-2021 (solid black line), the OFL control rule (dotted red line), the maxABC control rule (solid red line), B~35%~ (vertical grey line), and F~35%~ (horizontal grey line). The 2022 and 2023 spawning biomass and fishing mortality rates are as predicted by Alternatives 1 and 2 in the harvest projections.
